intro: Epilobium × sempronianum, commonly known as the common willowherb, is a flowering plant in the family Onagraceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its erect, branching stems and opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers with four petals, typically arranged in racemes. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wetlands, ditches, and along stream banks. Epilobium × sempronianum is known for its rapid growth and ability to colonize open areas, making it both a common weed and an important component of wetland ecosystems.
